Philippine: Spanish colonial government conducts the first official national census in the country.
Domingo Moriones y Murillo appointed Governor-General (1877–1880)
Russia: The Trial of the 193 occurred, punishing the participants of the Narodnik rebellion. Russo-Turkish War (1877–1878): Russia declared war on the Ottoman Empire.
Serbia: The Russo-Turkish War begins. The majority peoples, the Bosnian Serbs, launch an uprising against the Ottomans in Nevesinje declaring their unification with the Principality of Serbia. Nikola Pašić and Nicholas I of Montenegro proclaim the formal independence of Serbia and Montenegro. The Ottoman Empire declares war on Serbia and Montenegro.
Singapore:
Major General Edward Archibald Harbord Anson was appointed as the Acting Governor of the Straits Settlements.
The Chinese Protectorate is set up, and William Pickering was the first Protector appointed.
Sir William Cleaver Francis Robinson was appointed as the Governor of the Straits Settlements.
Switzerland: The Aare flooded, causing significant damage.
